programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Manchester City v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 12.30pm). Coverage of the top-flight match from Etihad Stadium. Spurs romped to a 4-0 victory in the corresponding fixture last season, with James Maddison scoring twice before the break, and Pedro Porro and Brennan Johnson adding to Tottenham's goal tally in the second half. At the time it was a fifth loss in a row for City, the first such sequence they had experienced since 2006, and their worst home loss since 2003 when Arsenal hammered them 5-1

programme.title: Live: Serie A
programme.desc: Sassuolo v Napoli (Kick-off 5.30pm). Coverage of the Italian top-flight match from Mapei Stadium - Città del Tricolore. Last season saw Napoli secure a second Scudetto in three seasons, and just their fourth league title overall, with former Manchester United midfielder Scott McTominay the unlikely hero as he scored 12 goals in a campaign that saw him named the league's Most Valuable Player, and subsequently shortlisted for the Ballon d'Or
